8.text:
I want to start by thanking you for the outstanding
work all of you are doing to provide healthy,

13.text:
delicious meals and snacks for children across
the country.

17.text:
Because of your dedication and creativity,
90 percent of America’s schools have now

22.text:
implemented the new standards in the Healthy
Hunger-Free Kids Act…and millions of kids

27.text:
are getting more of the nutrition they need
to succeed in school and in life.

32.text:
Now, I know this hasn’t always been easy…many
of you made a lot of changes in a very short

38.text:
period of time…and I know you’re still
working hard every day to meet the new standards.

43.text:
So we want to give you as much support and
as many resources as possible to help you

50.text:
That’s why today, I want to tell you about
some free training courses and materials that

55.text:
are being provided through a partnership between
the USDA and the National Food Service Management

62.text:
Whether you work in the cafeteria or manage
your school’s meal program, the Institute

67.text:
offers all kinds of training and technical
assistance on topics including financial management…menu

73.text:
planning…the Healthier U.S. School Challenge…plate
waste…and other important issues that you

81.text:
So go to NFSMI.org today and click on “training
opportunities” to learn about upcoming trainings

89.text: and to request a training in your area.

92.text:
The website also has materials that you can
download free of charge if you’re not able

97.text:
to attend the trainings in person…so you
can train yourself and your staff whenever

104.text:
Now these are wonderful resources…and I
hope that you will take advantage of them

108.text:
as you continue your tremendous work on behalf
of our children.

111.text:
My husband and I are so grateful for your
leadership and service, and I want to thank

116.text:
you again for everything you’ve done…and
I can’t wait to see all that you will achieve

120.text: in the months and years ahead.
